references.paper_title: Fundamental bounds on online strategic classification
references.reason: This paper provides instance-optimal regret bounds for online strategic classification in the realizable setting and improved regret in the agnostic setting, which are the main focuses of the current paper.
This seminal paper introduces the problem of strategic classification, laying the foundation for much of the subsequent work in this area, including the current paper.

This paper explores learnability gaps in strategic classification and provides an instance-optimal bound in a specific instance for online strategic classification, which are directly related to the themes of this paper.

references.paper_title: Strategic classification with unknown user manipulations
references.reason: This paper considers strategic classification when the learner has incomplete knowledge of the manipulation graph, which is directly related to the setting discussed in this paper.

This paper studies the problem of strategic classification in the offline setting, providing a theoretical foundation for understanding learnability in strategic settings that is relevant to the current paper.
